title: Better errors when inputs are omitted.
body:
It's not always possible to know if a transform consumes inputs, or can act as a root transform (and in fact some may be able to do both depending on their configuration), but when a transform expecting inputs doesn't get them the error can be quite obscure. This adds best-effort checking and a better error in that case.

We also allow explicitly setting empty imputs to work around this error (which is where most of the complexity of this change lies). Importantly, sources (no matter their name) are not required to have inputs.

------------------------

title: Post 2.50.0 Streamline release guide improvements
body:
This is a larger cleanup of the release guide to clarify timings and positioning of the broader steps.

Larger emphasis has been put on the Release Manager's role prior to the release cut. If issues are addressed in the main branch before the cut, they do not need to be addressed afterwards. The release manager is empowered to do so.

Clarify some timing around the begining and end of the release by calling out the preparation steps should be performed within the week prior to the release cut. Also call out that release finalization tasks can be done within a few hours of the release being completed.

While the guide isn't materially shorter, maintaining the simpler structure as in the overview will make it less overwheling to release managers, since it's clearer when the various subtasks apply, vs the previous "13" steps. This should clarify the "build release candidate + vote + fix" loop that is the bulk of a release manager's tasks. I believe this will help get to release candidates sooner.

Add a new section "Post Release Tasks" which is where the Playground update task lives. While it's part of the release tasks, it doesn't block the release overall, so it felt weird structurally to have it as important as "Build a Release Candidate".

Various minor typos and fixes.

Rendered version should become available here:

title: Return new ReflectData for both reflect datum reader and writer
body:
addresses #28279 

Avro has a discrepancy between reflect reader and writer side:
- In the reader side, `new ReflectDatumReader<>(clazz)` returns a [new model data](https://github.com/apache/avro/blob/60796e5df4581589717cfa32952da792dec79b68/lang/java/avro/src/main/java/org/apache/avro/reflect/ReflectDatumReader.java#L52)
- In the writer side `new ReflectDatumWriter<>(clazz)` returns the [singleton model data](https://github.com/apache/avro/blob/60796e5df4581589717cfa32952da792dec79b68/lang/java/avro/src/main/java/org/apache/avro/reflect/ReflectDatumWriter.java#L45)

Updating the model data's logical types is not a thread safe operation, so we must not use the singleton instance in this case.

title: Bump actions/setup-python from 2 to 4
body:
Bumps [actions/setup-python](https://github.com/actions/setup-python) from 2 to 4.
Release notes

Sourced from actions/setup-python's releases.

v4.0.0

What's Changed

  • Support for python-version-file input: #336

Example of usage:

- uses: actions/setup-python@v4
  with:
    python-version-file: '.python-version' # Read python version from a file
- run: python my_script.py

There is no default python version for this setup-python major version, the action requires to specify either python-version input or python-version-file input. If the python-version input is not specified the action will try to read required version from file from python-version-file input.

  • Use pypyX.Y for PyPy python-version input: #349

Example of usage:

- uses: actions/setup-python@v4
  with:
    python-version: 'pypy3.9' # pypy-X.Y kept for backward compatibility
- run: python my_script.py

  • RUNNER_TOOL_CACHE environment variable is equal AGENT_TOOLSDIRECTORY: #338

  • Bugfix: create missing pypyX.Y symlinks: #347

  • PKG_CONFIG_PATH environment variable: #400

  • Added python-path output: #405 python-path output contains Python executable path.

  • Updated zeit/ncc to vercel/ncc package: #393

  • Bugfix: fixed output for prerelease version of poetry: #409

  • Made pythonLocation environment variable consistent for Python and PyPy: #418

  • Bugfix for 3.x-dev syntax: #417

v3.1.4

What's Changed

In the scope of this patch release, the warning for deprecating Python 2.x was added in actions/setup-python#674 by @​dmitry-shibanov

For more information, check out actions/setup-python#672

title: Remove TableSchema to JSON conversion.
body:
This PR addresses #28080 by refactoring the static [BigQueryIO.read(SerializableFunction)](https://beam.apache.org/releases/javadoc/current/org/apache/beam/sdk/io/gcp/bigquery/BigQueryIO.html#read-org.apache.beam.sdk.transforms.SerializableFunction-) to not need a try/catch when invoking the DatumReaderFactory.

The existing code first converted the TableSchema to a JSON string using BigQueryIO.JSON_FACTORY's toString method. This throws an IOException that the original code logged as a warning. A GenericDatumTransformer's constructor received that JSON string that was used to set a private Suppler property, called tableSchema. This Supplier property, when invoked, would convert the JSON string back to a TableSchema object.

This PR simplifies the code by creating a new GenericDatumTransformer constructor that receives the TableSchema directly and sets the internal TableSchema property, removing the need for a Supplier and the need to re-parse the JSON string back to a TableSchema.

Since the existing GenericDatumTransformer constructor that received a JSON string representation of the TableSchema was public, I did not remove it.

To validate these changes, I ran:

`./gradlew :sdks:java:io:google-cloud-platform:check`

and

`./gradlew :sdks:java:io:google-cloud-platform:integrationTest`

title: [Java BQ] Storage API streaming load test
body:
Adding a streaming load test for writing via Storage API sink. Includes exactly-one and at-least-once semantics.

This test is set up to first write rows using batch FILE_LOADS mode to a "source of truth" table. Afterwards, it will write the same rows in streaming mode with Storage API to a second table. Then it will query between these two tables to check that they are identical. There is also the option of providing an existing table with the expected data, in which case the test will skip the first step.

The throughput, length of test (in minutes), and data shape can be changed by adding a new configuration line.

Also including a small addition: we can set an interval for the sink to intentionally crash every now and then. This is intended to test retry resilience. The sink will sometimes throw an exception to simulate a work item failure, and other times will exit the system to simulate a worker failure. Either way, we expect the pipeline to pick up where it left off and deliver data appropriately.

title: Publish Checkstyle Results
body:
This PR was created to add an action that visualize the results of Checkstyle tests and adds them to the workflow summary page.

The action requires additional permissions:
checks: write (allow to add test result to workflow summary page)

Example runs:
no error: https://github.com/magicgoody/beam/actions/runs/5964470451
with error: https://github.com/magicgoody/beam/actions/runs/5949179444

title: Add support to ApproximateQuantiles to compress the element buffers.
body:
Such buffers can be large and not be modified during combining if only a few elements are added to the accumulator. To save space, the buffers are compressed before writing. Unmodified buffers are optimized to not decompress/compress but just be rewritten.

Add support for CombineFnTester to cover encoding/decoding during combiner merging.

Related to issue #28388

title: Fix java17 PostCommit ARM test config issue
body:
Java17 test suite failed because of test configuration issue:
![image](https://github.com/apache/beam/assets/61256376/0bb331e4-0164-4e74-b6a2-3b45d22ac1f4)

which is caused by the --release flag added here: https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/a434a31507895ecfef3be94bdc1729cf376ebf56/buildSrc/src/main/groovy/org/apache/beam/gradle/BeamModulePlugin.groovy#L1489
This PR:
- Replaced the --release flag with -source -target to compile, reference: https://github.com/eclipse-tycho/tycho/issues/619#issuecomment-1285022312
- Removed Werror flag that causes all compiler warnings to be treated as errors, otherwise the tests would fail to compile.
Now All versions of PostCommit Java Dataflow Example ARM tests passed.
------------------------

title: Keep track of metrics at the KeyedModelHandler level
body:
This adds metrics at the per cohort level and aggregate metrics when using a KeyedModelHandler with per key models. We override the base metrics for 2 reasons:

1) We want to keep track of metrics at the per cohort level
2) Model loading happens at a different place in this flow (we load a model right before inference if its not already loaded)

Part of #27628

title: Connect GitHub Actions builds to ge.apache.org and remote build cache
body:
The Beam project uses a remote cache node at [beam-cache.apache.org/cache](https://beam-cache.apache.org/cache/) to reduce build time. Only builds on [ci-beam.apache.org](https://ci-beam.apache.org/) are currently able to write to the cache.

As requested [here](https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/27015#issuecomment-1667925540), this PR allows the same level of access to the cache for GitHub Actions as is currently in place for Jenkins builds. This will require using a few GitHub Actions secrets in GitHub Actions workflows:
- GE_ACCESS_TOKEN - An Apache organization secret that allows publishing build scans
- GE_CACHE_USERNAME / GE_CACHE_PASSWORD - A Beam project secret that allows authenticating to the remote cache as a user with read/write permissions

A few caveats to this PR:
- GitHub Actions does not allow accessing secrets from PRs issued from forks. While a crucial security feature, it makes this PR difficult to test. It would be nice to validate against a feature branch within Beam before being merged.
- The nature of authoring GitHub Actions requires quite a lot of repetition in this PR. While I do not see a better way to do this, I am certainly open to suggestions.
- Future versions of Gradle Enterprise should allow us to do this in a way where we do not have to use the username/password secrets. When that day comes, we can make that update.

fixes #28211

title: Add warning about adding artifacts output to the transformed dataset
body:
The artifacts such as min, max, word_count are computed as an extra data point for the users. these artifacts are computed over the entire dataset and to output them along with the transformed elements, we need to broadcast the artifact size on to the transformed data size. By doing so,  we output same artifact value for each element in the entire dataset and this is expected since the values should be same for the entire dataset. This PR adds a warning for the users about this behavior.

title: [prism] Fail jobs on SDK disconnect.
body:
If the control connection for a job is lost, eg. by an SDK worker crash (detected via grpc stream context cancel), then fail all extant instructions, and terminate the job, rather than leave it running perpetually.

Further, ensure the extant bundles are cleaned up from the element manager, to allow failed jobs to be properly garbage collected.

Reduce routine log messages to debug to avoid noise.

Use ctx.WithCancelCause properly, which requires calling context.Cause on the context.

Restructures the bundle processing loop in execute.go to better allow for eager bundle splitting. Would need to move bundle data acquisition to be moved out of stage.Execute, and split there.

Special thanks to the Swift SDK for being in a crashing on worker state to reliably validate this.

Related #28187

title: [#28187][prism] worker shutdown, cleanup, log fail, port spec, grpc recv size
body:
Some fixes while trying to use the experimental Swift SDK against prism.

* Use an actual loopback address for endpoints instead of the net package listener default of unspecified.
  * IPv6 uses "[::]" to mean an unspecified address, which Go then treats as the loopback address. This isn't true across all SDKs, so we must explicitly indicate the loopback address.
  * Note: We create the server to listen to any traffic to that port however, so other connections, possibly off the machine, remain valid.
* Increase default receive buffer to max.
* Fail jobs if the SDK worker doesn't connect after 1 minute.
* Error job failures on log on slog side.
* Minor log clean up, to a debug log.

Related to #28187

------------------------

title: Bump github.com/proullon/ramsql from 0.0.1 to 0.1.2 in /sdks
body:
Bumps [github.com/proullon/ramsql](https://github.com/proullon/ramsql) from 0.0.1 to 0.1.2.
Release notes

Sourced from github.com/proullon/ramsql's releases.

v0.1.2

What's Changed

  • fix: AttributeSelector returns error containing unfound attribute name by @​proullon in proullon/ramsql#90

Full Changelog: https://github.com/proullon/ramsql/compare/v0.1.1...v0.1.2

Fix regression on CamelCase attribute query

What's Changed

  • fix(engine): Relation.Attribute() convert name argument to lower case by @​trakhimenok in proullon/ramsql#87
  • fix: (close #86) AttributeSelector uses lower case to match attributes by @​proullon in proullon/ramsql#88

New Contributors

  • @​trakhimenok made their first contribution in proullon/ramsql#87

Full Changelog: https://github.com/proullon/ramsql/compare/v0.1.0...v0.1.1

Transaction based rewrite

Context

Introduction of agnostic in-memory store, leveraging GC-optimized storage to garantee low GC pauses and good GC behavior over time.

Complete rewrite improving performance, removing deadlocks and storage as Go types, allowing creation of objects table.

Ensure compatibility with gorm, a popular Go ORM.

Added implementation goal in README, in preparation for stable 1.0 release.

What's Changed

  • Implement SCHEMA by @​proullon in proullon/ramsql#76
  • feat: handle Gorm query style by @​proullon in proullon/ramsql#77
  • add/scientific notation by @​Joematpal in proullon/ramsql#78
  • Rewrite engine with SQL-agnostic GC optimized memory store by @​proullon in proullon/ramsql#80
  • Fix driver transaction behavior by @​proullon in proullon/ramsql#84
  • fix: insert mixed case value attribute by @​proullon in proullon/ramsql#85

Full Changelog: https://github.com/proullon/ramsql/compare/v0.0.1...v0.1.0

Commits
  • 8cb2915 fix: AttributeSelector returns error containing unfound attribute name
  • 71d06ed fix: AttributeSelector uses lower case to match attributes
  • 5b0278f fix: add failing test for CamelCase query
  • 481f3e2 fix(engine): Relation.Attribute() convert name argument to lower case to be c...
  • e12c987 fix: insert mixed case value attribute
  • a7e15a6 fix: use driver.Conn as Tx
  • d851e3f feat: extend transaction testing
  • 6014112 chore: update travis go version
  • dc4783e feat: add test for #40
  • 7e9cda5 chore: update benchstat
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

title: Add Speech Emotion Recognition TensorFlow Notebook
body:
Added a notebook demonstrating the use of Beam in audio processing. It achieves the following:
* Imports and processes the CREMA-D dataset for speech emotion analysis.
* Perform various data augmentation and feature extraction techniques using the Librosalibrary.
* Develops a TensorFlow model to classify emotions.
* Stores the trained model.
* Constructs a Beam pipeline that:
  * Creates a PCollection of audio samples.
  * Applies preprocessing transforms.
  * Utilizes the trained model to predict emotions.
  * Stores the emotion predictions.

 - [ ] Mention the appropriate issue in your description (for example: `addresses #123`), if applicable. This will automatically add a link to the pull request in the issue. If you would like the issue to automatically close on merging the pull request, comment `fixes #<ISSUE NUMBER>` instead.
